title: RSI, BBands, Fib Levels
description: Master the three most essential technical indicators. Learn to use RSI for momentum, Bollinger Bands for volatility, and Fibonacci levels for price targets.

modules.title: RSI Momentum Analysis
modules.description: Learn to use RSI for momentum and divergence signals

lessons.title: RSI Fundamentals
lessons.content:
The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a momentum oscillator that measures the speed and magnitude of price changes. It's one of the most reliable indicators for identifying overbought and oversold conditions.

**RSI Basics:**
â€¢ Range: 0 to 100
â€¢ Overbought: Above 70
â€¢ Oversold: Below 30
â€¢ Neutral: 30-70 range
â€¢ Default period: 14

**RSI Interpretation:**
â€¢ Above 70 = potentially overbought
â€¢ Below 30 = potentially oversold
â€¢ Centerline (50) = momentum balance
â€¢ Divergence = potential reversal
â€¢ Failure swings = trend continuation

**Why RSI Works:**
â€¢ Measures momentum
â€¢ Identifies extremes
â€¢ Shows divergence
â€¢ Confirms trends
â€¢ Provides entry/exit signals

lessons.title: RSI Divergence
lessons.content:
**Bullish Divergence:**
â€¢ Price makes lower low
â€¢ RSI makes higher low
â€¢ Potential reversal up
â€¢ Strong buy signal
â€¢ Volume confirmation needed

**Bearish Divergence:**
â€¢ Price makes higher high
â€¢ RSI makes lower high
â€¢ Potential reversal down
â€¢ Strong sell signal
â€¢ Volume confirmation needed

**Hidden Divergence:**
â€¢ Price makes higher low
â€¢ RSI makes lower low
â€¢ Trend continuation
â€¢ Pullback opportunity
â€¢ Entry signal

modules.title: Bollinger Bands Volatility
modules.description: Master Bollinger Bands for volatility and trend analysis

lessons.title: Bollinger Bands Basics
lessons.content:
**Bollinger Bands Components:**
â€¢ Middle band (20-period SMA)
â€¢ Upper band (+2 standard deviations)
â€¢ Lower band (-2 standard deviations)
â€¢ Bandwidth (volatility measure)
â€¢ %B (price position)

**Band Interpretation:**
â€¢ Price near upper = potentially overbought
â€¢ Price near lower = potentially oversold
â€¢ Bands squeeze = low volatility
â€¢ Bands expand = high volatility
â€¢ Price outside bands = extreme move

**Trading Signals:**
â€¢ Bounce from lower band = buy
â€¢ Rejection from upper band = sell
â€¢ Breakout from squeeze = trend
â€¢ Mean reversion = counter-trend

lessons.title: Bollinger Band Strategies
lessons.content:
**Squeeze Strategy:**
â€¢ Bands contract = low volatility
â€¢ Breakout expected
â€¢ Prepare for big move
â€¢ Volume confirms direction
â€¢ Position for breakout

**Mean Reversion:**
â€¢ Price touches upper band = sell
â€¢ Price touches lower band = buy
â€¢ Use RSI for confirmation
â€¢ Set tight stops
â€¢ Take profits quickly

**Trend Following:**
â€¢ Price stays in upper band = uptrend
â€¢ Price stays in lower band = downtrend
â€¢ Ride the trend
â€¢ Use pullbacks for entries
â€¢ Trail stops with bands

modules.title: Fibonacci Retracements
modules.description: Learn to use Fibonacci levels for price targets and support/resistance

lessons.title: Fibonacci Fundamentals
lessons.content:
**Fibonacci Sequence:**
â€¢ 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21...
â€¢ Golden ratio = 1.618
â€¢ Retracement levels
â€¢ Extension levels
â€¢ Natural support/resistance

**Key Retracement Levels:**
â€¢ 23.6% (shallow pullback)
â€¢ 38.2% (moderate pullback)
â€¢ 50.0% (halfway point)
â€¢ 61.8% (deep pullback)
â€¢ 78.6% (extreme pullback)

**Extension Levels:**
â€¢ 127.2% (beyond swing)
â€¢ 161.8% (golden ratio)
â€¢ 261.8% (major extension)
â€¢ 423.6% (extreme extension)

**Why Fibonacci Works:**
â€¢ Natural market psychology
â€¢ Self-fulfilling prophecy
â€¢ Institutional use
â€¢ Technical analysis convergence

lessons.title: Fibonacci Trading
lessons.content:
**Retracement Trading:**
â€¢ Buy at 38.2% or 61.8%
â€¢ Stop loss below 78.6%
â€¢ Target at 127.2%
â€¢ Use volume confirmation
â€¢ Multiple timeframes

**Extension Trading:**
â€¢ Target at 161.8%
â€¢ Use for profit taking
â€¢ Set trailing stops
â€¢ Monitor momentum
â€¢ Adjust for volatility

**Confluence Trading:**
â€¢ Fib + support/resistance
â€¢ Fib + trend lines
â€¢ Fib + moving averages
â€¢ Multiple confirmations
â€¢ Higher probability trades
